content.description: Climb the flake up to the ledge.  Build a tree anchor to belay from.
content.location: Located around the corner from Boggle the Mind.  Climbs the obvious flake.

content.description: Stick to the right of the bolt line following the easiest path up the wall.  Catch a rest if you can before you move into the sustained finish.
content.location: Climbs up the gold streak near the center of the South wall.

content.description: The lone route on the North side of the boulder. Follow a dirty crack up to a ledge.  Build a belay anchor in the horizontal crack.
content.protection: Gear Anchor.  Rappel off a tree on top of the boulder.

content.description: Climb the obvious flake up to a chossy band of rock at the top of the flake.  Once at the roof, move up and right around the roof to the low anchors.
content.location: Located on the main cliffline just uphill from the Munchkin Block.

content.description: Move up the thin crack, being mindful of the fragile face holds lining the crack.  Move left at the top to use the anchors at the top of Thin Air.
content.location: Climbs the obvious, but thin crack on the right side of gold streak on the South wall.

content.description: Work your way up a flared crack on tricky moves to a high first piece.  The difficulty backs off as  you move into an easier section with slopers that take you up to a nice ledge.  Move right to finish in a left facing dihedral.  Top out and belay from a tree.
content.protection: Standard Rack. Tree Anchor.  Rap from Tree.
content.location: Starts about 20 feet to the left of Silverfish on the main cliffline just above the Munchkin Block.

content.description: A tricky boulder problem start leads to a sustained jug haul up to shared anchors.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on the South side of the boulder.  It starts just right of the arete.

content.description: Easy climbing down low leads into an intimidating,  but fairly easy roof crack.  Finish by stemming around a wide crack and topout.  Build a tree anchor to belay from.
content.protection: Standard Rack. Tree Anchor.  Rap from tree.
content.location: Obvious crack to the right of Silverfish.

content.description: Get your crimp on down low and finish on big moves up top.
content.location: Route is near the middle of the wall and climbs up through the light grey rock which is flanked by gold streaks on either side.

climbs.name: The Air is Getting Slippery
climbs.fa: Clay Frisbie, Tom Hancock, Chuck Caughlin

content.description: The tallest route in the area and the only route on the East side of the boulder.  Starts near the middle of the wall on thin crimps on a slab.  Move up the slab to the roof and move out left around the roof.  The short section above the roof has nice holds all the way to the anchors.
content.protection: 9 bolts plus 2 bolt anchor.  Bring slings to extend some key placements to reduce rope drag.
content.location: This route is on the East side of the boulder and starts near the middle of the wall.

content.description: Start with some awkward crimps to get up to better holds near the finish.  Shares a finish and anchors with Boggle the Mind.
content.location: Just right of Boggle the Mind, 2nd route from the left on the South side of the boulder.

content.description: This is a small area consisting of climbs almost entirely on a freestanding boulder called Munchkin Block that is up to 65' tall on one side.
